sentences.english: Liberty is in every blow! Let us do or die. ----- Robbert Burns, British poet.
sentences.chinese: 自由存在于每一次争斗中，让我们决一死战。

sentences.english: Two gentlemen swore to fight to the death.
sentences.chinese: 两位绅士誓要决一死战。

sentences.english: Two groups of people have launched a dying war immediately in the room.
sentences.chinese: 当时狂骂那家伙一顿帮人立即在屋内展开了一场死战。

sentences.english: The stage is set for a gruesome battle between the two nemeses, but only one can survive.
sentences.chinese: 最后的决死战，只有一个能生存下去。

sentences.english: Abandoning armor and carrying minimal rations, this is to motivate the troops.
sentences.chinese: 舍弃笨重装备，少带粮食，以激发士卒死战的决心。

definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to fight with all one's might
multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers
to seek life in death (idiom); to fight for one's life
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to vow to fight to the death
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
